You can search for libraries of ready4 modules using tools from the ready4 R package. 
<br/><br/>

```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
library(ready4)
```

<br/><br/>
To create the most up to date summary table of libraries of ready4 modules, you can use the `make_libraries_tb` function.
<br/><br/>

```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
libraries_tb <-  make_libraries_tb("modules")
```

<br/><br/>
Because the `make_libraries_tb` function is generated by scraping multiple ready4 R package websites, it can be a little slow to execute. A slightly faster alternative is the `get_libraries_tb` function, that downloads a pre-made and periodically updated (and therefore potentially dated) table.
<br/><br/>

```{r eval=FALSE}
# Not run
# libraries_tb <- get_libraries_tb()
```

<br/><br/>
Whichever method you use to generate the table, you can format the table for HTML output using the `print_packages` function.
<br/><br/>

```{r eval=F}
print_packages(libraries_tb,
               include_1L_chr = "modules")
```
<br/><br/>

```{r echo=F}
print_packages(libraries_tb,
               include_1L_chr = "modules")
```
